02mar (Table 3) Marion, G. M. (2002) "A molal-based model for strong acid chemistry at low temperatures (less than 200 to 298 K)", Geochimica et Cosmochimica Acta, Vol. 66, No. 14, pp. 2499-2516. See spreadsheet "Pitzer_Params_Test_UO2NO32_HNO3_NaNO3_CFJC.xls" for calculated values. These parameters are derived from the mole fraction model of Clegg and Brimblecombe (1990) but were parameterized by Marion (2002) for the Pitzer molality-based model.

species.name: TBP(org)
species.source: CFJC: Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on enthalpies of formation from Starostin et al. (1966) and standard entropies estimated from Glasser and Jenkins (2004)

species.name: (TBP)2(org)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on enthalpies of formation from Starostin et al. (1966) and standard entropies estimated from Glasser and Jenkins (2004)

species.name: TBP(aq)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on LLE data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org)

species.name: TBP*HNO3(org)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on LLE data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org)

species.name: TBP*H2O(org)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on LLE data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org). Data udate for the system TBP-H2O system is from Naganawa and Tachimori (1994), Analytical Sciences, Vol. 10, p. 607-613. This data is consistent with the presence of the organic species (TBP)2*(H2O)2(org) and (TBP)3*(H2O)6(org). DG0_f_Pr_Tr units="cal/gmol"> -283089.65 is the OLD VALUE!!!! That is, it's quite remarkable how close these values are considering the assumptions and treatment in the original extraction of this value.

species.name: (TBP)2*(H2O)2(org)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on extraction data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org). Extraction data for the TBP-H2O system is from Naganawa and Tachimori (1994), Analytical Sciences, Vol. 10, p. 607-613.

species.name: (TBP)3*(H2O)6(org)
species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on LLE data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org). Data udate for the system TBP-H2O system is from Naganawa and Tachimori (1994), Analytical Sciences, Vol. 10, p. 607-613. This data is consistent with the presence of the organic species (TBP)2*(H2O)2(org) and (TBP)3*(H2O)6(org).

species.source: CFJC Gibbs energy of formation retrieval based on LLE data and thermodynamic data for TBP(org)
